revised_title: Society's Publication and Distribution of Papers
tldr: The article outlines the rules and procedures for publishing and distributing the Philosophical Transactions of the Royal Society of London. It explains how the transactions are printed for the benefit of the society's members, the process of delivering copies to the fellows, and the conditions under which fellows are entitled to receive them. It also discusses the handling of surplus copies and the distribution of papers to the public.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Publishing History
